results.title: Reading Planet
results.brief_description: A unique four part series, now on the one tape, designed to help students improve their reading and writing skills. An alien from the Reading Planet, Prism, transports five students into outer space where they discover that reading can be fun: The four programs on the videotape are: 1. “Turn on the TV in Your Head”, 2. “Escape from Lethargia”, 3. “Time Scrambler”, 4. “Hope of the Future”. Rated: G

results.title: Reading planet
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description: Prism a young alien from the planet Reading is given the task of improving the reading skills of five earth students. Through their various adventures the audience is introduced to techniques such as deriving meaning from context, visualisation, etc.

results.title: Reading photographs
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
The works of specific photographers are examined to illustrate that visual communication carries more emotional, political and cultural impact than verbal communication. Warns the viewer to be aware of various visual stimuli.

results.title: Reading on
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Follow up to “Beginning Reading” which looked at reading in the infant school. This program looks at strategies for the teaching of reading from Years 3-7. Practising clasroom teachers present their individual approaches for the teaching of reading at these levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Reading maps
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Designed for use in elementary social studies teaching, this film is an introduction to the study of maps, A young boy leans about the use of maps by following roads and by locating various places. He is shown how to read a map by observing the title, scale, direction symbols and legend.

results.title: Reading is....
results.creator_credit: Don MacDonald, Mark Chodzko and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Portrays the relationship that develops between a young boy and an older girl through a common bond - reading. The girl is having difficulties in her family life because of her brother’s terminal illness: she finds a release from this stress when, with the encouragement of the young boy who is a keen reader, she develops an awareness of the benefits of reading. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Reading for what? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Allen and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early years at school”.
Deals analytically with areas of importance and concern to teachers of children aged three to nine. Examines the question of why most children learn to read but do not always read for pleasure or purpose.

results.title: Reading for meaning: the Goodman Model (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Watch your language”
Understanding the reading process. Professors Ken and Yetta Goodman discuss the problems of the teaching of reading with a class of teachers in Australia. Docments some of their main propositions relating to language in use, miscue analysis and reading. Stresses the need to focus on the strengths of children and not simply the weaknesses.
Suitable for teacher level.
